intro: Diogenesia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian diogenesia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided foliage, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Diogenesia boliviana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
